roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

roles.role_title: Chief Justice of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: We'll hear argument now in Number oh oh seventeen fifty-one, Susan Tave Zelman, Superintendent of Public Instruction of Ohio versus Doris Simmons-Harris, and two related cases.
Ms. French.
[Inaudible]
Thank you, Mr. Chief Justice, and may it please the Court.
In nineteen ninety-five, the Ohio General Assembly responded to an unprecedented educational crisis by enacting the Ohio Scholarship and Tutorial Program.

Under this Court's decisions, especially Mueller, Witters, and Zobrest, and in light of this Court's teachings, most recently in Agostini and Mitchell, the Ohio program is constitutional because it offers a neutral program that offers true private choice to parents.
First, the principle of neutrality.
There are two criteria that determine where the benefits will go under the program.
First is residence in a school district that is or has been taken over by State control.
Second is family income.
Neither of these criteria has anything to do with religion, but even beyond these basic...
elements...
Well, do you you don't take the...

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: position that that guarantees constitutionality, do you?
We do not, Your Honor.
We ha- have a two-pronged approach and that...

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: W- t- so, you take it as a necessary condition, but not a sufficient condition?
We do, Your Honor.

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: And you think it would be unconstitutional if it didn't have that...
Not necessarily, Your Honor, but it certainly goes to the neutrality of the program,
but even beyond the nondiscrim-

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: matter? I mean, if- if they're proselytizing, doesn't it make good sense for them to admit anybody who may come along, and yet the proselytizing can't be subsidized under the Establishment Clause?
We, of course, Your Honor, do not agree that they're proselytizing.
and perhaps I should move to the second prong, then, and talk about-
An- and talk about the true private choice that is at issue here for the...
parents.

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: I- I take it that the first part of your argument as demonstrated is to try to show that there are certain in- indexes, indicia of neutrality.
Correct.

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: and you tick them off.
Yes, Your Honor.
Third and...

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: percentage of the students in the school system are get vouchers?
Well, there are fifty-seven thousand students elementary students in the in the in the Cleveland School District, Your Honor.
scholarships.

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: many thousand get scholarships, two thousand?
I- in nineteen ninety-nine the number was thirty-seven hundred.
It's now about forty-four Yes, Your Honor, a little less than ten percent,
but all the students in the s- Cleveland School District are eligible.
Schools...

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: you a question about private choice which is a very important part of the case? Supposing you had a situation with a small community that had one public school and one religious school, and they would pay for the voucher to go to the religious school if the family, on its own private choice, wanted to go to the re- the child to go to the religious school.
I think it would, Your Honor given i- i- if of course, this...

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: irrelevant, really that there're four or five choices available, as long as there's a free choice either to go to the public school or to go to the religious school? Well, we have a number of choices within the...
traditional public schools, Your Honor. They are...
not necessary, Your Honor.
his whole point...

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: there's such a dramatic difference between a choice from the great universe of colleges and universities, what a particular student will choose, and here, the difference you just explained to Justice Stevens that maybe it doesn't matter.
That's currently true, Your Honor.
true...

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: why we don't take account of the availability of the community schools in analyzing this program? We would like the Court to take very much account of the...
community schools, Your Honor. That's correct, Your Honor. The...

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: in fact, to the parents?
Very much so, Your Honor.

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: And the tuition assistance would be provided if the selection were for a community school?

There would be no tuition assistance, Your Honor, only because they are public schools, so there's no need for a scholarship there Parents can choose a traditional public school, they can choose a tutoring grant if they're in a if they're in a public school, they can choose a magnet school, they can choose a community school, or...

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: And if- if a community school is selected, no additional money then is provided, as would be provided i- if the religious school were selected? That's true, Your Honor.
It's only if...

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: have some of the private nonsectarian schools in the city become community schools?
They have, Your Honor.
Are there...

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: Because they get more...
money. That's that's the...
more money, and in part because of the uncertainty of the litigation.

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: Are slots available in the community schools for these children that we're talking about?
Yes, Your Honor, there are spots...
available.
Available in both...
community schools...

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

roles.role_title: Chief Justice of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: tutoring grant if you go to a community school?
Yes, Your Honor, you can.

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: Is there anything in the record about the quality of these community schools? There was one brief that said they were too new, too few, too unregulated, too untested to count.
I would direct the Court to two places in the record, particularly the joint appendix.
for them.

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: there a description of the precise community schools that are par- participating in the program, and the quality of education in those schools?
There is to to the first part of your question, Your Honor, and that's in Mr. Puckett's affidavit, of just describing what the schools are, why we have them in Ohio.

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: Is there information in the record about the quality of the religiously affiliated schools?
There're there are a number of studies that have been done both in Cleveland and with respect to other pro- other scholarship pr- programs, Your Honor.
appendix and that...

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: particular schools in this program.
Yes, Your Honor, in general the scholarship program, not just specifically the religious schools, but the voucher er the scholarship program as a whole,

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: Hm.
as to whether the students are showing academic achievement or, you know, significant results beyond that.

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: Just, before we leave the community schools, when the State calculates the funding that goes to the community schools, it takes account of the number of students that go to the community schools, I take it.
Oh, yes, Your Honor,
it's...

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: figure of something like five thousand dollars...
Yes.

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: per student not quite that.
Right.

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: Does the same amount of money per capita go to a community school as would go to the regular public school...
annually?
approximately.

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: May I ask you if this Court would have to overrule the Nyquist case to support your position?
It certainly...

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: points the other way, doesn't it?

It does point the other way, Your Honor, but we think that there are a number of distinctions which this Court has drawn between the programs at issue, say, in Mueller and Witters that distinguish it from the New York program at issue in Nyquist.
which can...

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: concern about the Establishment Clause?

Well, this Court has pointed to specifically footnote thirty-eight, where the Court reserved judgment in the Nyquist decision for programs that offered a benefit, the specific example was scholarships there, and offered to a broad base of beneficiaries without regard to the nonpublic or public or nonsectarian, sectarian nature of the institutions benefited which is precisely precisely what is happening here.

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: Well, but doesn't that simply then go back to this neutrality point, and you're saying because it's neutral, in the sense that it's offered in an even-handed way, query I'm me- your your friends on the other tide dispute that, but just accepting that categorization, because it's neutral in that sense, that's a distinction which ought to make a difference in the result.
We, of course, disagree, Your Honor, that there is a massive amount going to religious schools as a result of something that the Government is doing.
we were on...

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: term as result of what the Government is doing, which is a separate issue as to whether what the significance is of the private choice, but the the effect that Nyquist was concerned with, and the effect that I think has been shown here, is a substantial amount of money, A to the schools themselves, and in relation to the amount of money spent on the program,
and in those...

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: respects the the two are identical.

Well, in that respect, Your Honor, there's no question that there is money that is ending up in religious institutions, because that's what the what the parents have chosen, but that nondiscrimination provision that I spoke of earlier did not exist in Nyquist.
to all comers.

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

roles.role_title: Chief Justice of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: also made the point, I think, that where the parents do the choosing, as they did not do in Nyquist, it was a different ball game.
Absolutely, Your Honor.
that rule...

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: closest of our cases, do you think, to the Ohio program? Is it Witters?
I would suggest Witters, Your Honor, because it's a financial aid going to there it was a college student, but an adult, to make a decision about where to send the money.
The difference would be...

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: The difference would be however that according to respondents the choices are much more limited here...
than in...

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: Witters.

That's true, Your Honor, but in Mueller the Court did address that concern, as Justice Powell said in his concurrence in Witters that it didn't matter that there was only one person, Mr. Witters, using the money for seminary, for the Inland Empire School of the Bible, nor did it matter in Zobrest that there was only one child or one parent set of parents for a child looking for an interpretive or religious school.
[Inaudible]

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: part of the design of the program is to have a structure which will encourage over the long term more and different kinds of school choices,
in- i- including,

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: of course the community schools...
Absolutely, Your Honor.

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: suggestion that in Nyquist, it's a difference when the parents do the choosing, well who chose where the schoo- children would go to school in Nyquist? Didn't the parents de- make the decision?
The parents, of course, did,
Your Honor.

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: same case.
I disagree, Your Honor.

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

roles.role_title: Chief Justice of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: Very well, Ms. French.
Mr. Chief Justice, may it please the Court.
and  Nyquist.

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: the money went to families with children in nonpublic schools, but that's exactly what's happening here.
Your Honor, if...

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: just for people in the nonpublic schools?
Your Honor, it isn't exactly the same at all.
Nyquist...

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: that the vouchers are just for people in nonpublic schools?
In this...
case, no.
Your Honor, we have tutorial vouchers for people in in public schools, and tutorial vouchers for magnet schools and community...
schools.

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: tutorial vouchers, why is the number of tutorial vouchers limited to the same number of vouchers for paid to the private schools?

Well, I would s- Your Honor, I would suspect the answer to that is to try to provide some form of equality and and to make sure that there was no Government endorsement of one choice or another, so the e- equality of having the same number of grants for for tutoring being the same as the same number going for scholarships.

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: Of course, the amount of money is vastly different, isn't it, because the I forget the figures exactly, but isn't the the limit on the tutorial something like three hundred and fifty dollars a student, as opposed to the two thousand some odd limit on the on the tuition vouchers?
Your Honor, there is a difference, but there is less a difference than the difference between the public school and the nonpublic school deductions taken in Mueller.

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: Well, you wouldn't limit it to the vouchers anyway, would you? I mean, you would you would think that we have to look at the money that goes to the community schools.
Th- that is ab-

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: go via bou- vouchers, but goes directly to the schools, and it's a greater amount of money that goes to the private schools, isn't it?
Your Honor, I think the fact there is no question that when this program was initially implemented, every single secular school in the district signed up to participate.
[Inaudible]

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: what is actually bother- i- I'd like to hear what you say about the endorsement point that Justice Souter initially raised, and my thought is, I'll assume no discrimination, and I'll assume it's a fine program, but imagine you came from Europe or Africa, or a different place, and said, what do they do in the United States by way of educating their children, and you're told, well, sixty billion dollars a year, forty billion, or some very large amount of money is being spent by the Government to give children K through twelve what is basically a religiously oriented education taught by a parochial school.
Thank you, Your Honor.

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: There's an irony, I g- are you is that...
I could go on, Your Honor, but...

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: No, if if I mean, the irony is that the better the parochial school, in a sense, the less the freedom of choice.
Your Honor...
most of th-

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: mean, I I no one's complaining about the quality of of of the program.

For the reasons I've already noted, Your Honor, I believe there is no governmental no governmental endorsement, and you have to realize that i- th- th- the overwhelming majority of the elible [: eligible] eligible children elected to remain in the public school, and incidentally...
there are states...

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: Justice Breyer could send his child to one of the community schools, which is entirely nonsectarian, under this program, right?
Y- Y- Your Honor, that's another alternative, and I think we...

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: Which schools would get more money than the than the th- than the sectarian schools anyway.
Your Honor, I see that as another reason why no one could say there's a reasonable message of governmental endorsement in this case.

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: You you agree that the Sixth Circuit erred.

Your Honor, the same approach was taken by Judge Oliver, but I d- don't feel that the Sixth Circuit really understood how the community school program worked, or how one could use the tutorial vouchers to help the children that elected to go to the community schools.

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: Well, there's really no record on the community schools, you're saying, because you weren't permitted to make a record?

Your Honor, there is an extensive record fr- of in affidavits in terms of the creation of the of the of the community schools, the transfer of the two secular scholarship schools to community school status.

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: Do we have to link the two programs together to resolve the case?
Your Honor, I believe not.

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: trogram [: program] and the money paid to the parents and endorsed over to the schools in the case of choice? Do we have to consider both together?
Your Honor, I would consider them together, but it was it's the all of the indicia of choice, not just the endorsement.

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

roles.role_title: Chief Justice of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: Thank you, Mr. Young.
Mr. Chief Justice, and may it please the Court.

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: No but I think you would say the program was still constitutional, even if it was just conceived in the healthiest school system in the world.

Well, perhaps, Justice Stevens, I might, but this does i- this th- as this Court has taught repeatedly, the background history and the context informs the decision which this Court has endorsed with respect to what the effects or endorsement test would be, measured by what a reasonable, objective observer would believe the State or the Government was doing.
suggests...

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: that argument is, why did they make th- this wonderful solution available to such a small percentage of the student body?

What what I w- I would d- invite the Court's attention to page forty-one of the Taylor petitioner's brief, which contains a chart which shows the various choices which were made available to the students as a result of the composite, the context of the program that we're considering.
attention...

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: I I didn't I didn't quite understand Justice Stevens' question.
students?
I I...
What I meant...

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: program was available to all the...
students.
I I stand corrected.
students.

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: could have gone into into a one of the community schools, or to one of the private schools,
isn't that right?
an- and th- and the record is quite clear on this, also.
school.

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: there doesn't seem to be a record on this very clear, that my impression was really the parochial schools are an awful lot better.
but but...

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: to send the...
case back? Does it turn on?
No, no.

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

roles.role_title: Chief Justice of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: Well if la- mi- mi- General Olson, if if a private indiv- individual s- challenges a State law as unconstitutional, the burden of proof is on that individual, isn't it, to m- show the necessary facts to establish unconstitutionality?
Yes, Mr. Chief Justice, absolutely, but the record here in goes even further than that, because the record that is available shows these many alternatives.
available.

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: to ask how the courts faced with this challenge have to view the case.
Yes, Justice O'Connor, I believe that that is the...
correct context.

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: below not...
do that?
court made a m- a legal error in failing to do so, because this Court has taught over and over again that the context is extremely...
important in history.

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: only to low income children, or does it just i- does that affect the amount of money to be given?
It affects both the amount of money to be given and the preference.

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: There's only a finite amount of money available.
Well, that's always the case, of...
course in any...
Government program, but the priorities are given to the low income people.
the alterna-

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: was no attempt made in the program to make sure that the money that ends up in the parochial schools is not used for religious training, or teaching.

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: There there have been other Federal programs, for example, where there have been such limitations on usage.
here.

that's correct, Justice O'Connor, but the Court has made the made the point in connection with those types of programs that there's a significant difference between a direct aid program, where funds are going from the Government to the school, as opposed to the private cho- p- genuinely independent, purely private choice programs where the choices are being made by individual parents, and meing [: being] being made by individual parents motivated by the best education for their children.
of choices...

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: very question, do you think these alternatives are essential from a constitutional point of view, or would you make the same argument if there were merely the one choice,
religious school or the public school?
applying the k- the standards this Court has adopted, that th- the euv- if the n- criteria are neutral and I'm answering I mak- I'm saying...
yes and tha-

roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: You can either go to the public school, or you can go to the parochial school, and if you go to the parochial school, we'll pay the tuition.
Which we're we're also offeri- an- the...
the yes. Yes.

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: here, but what would you do with that...
case?

if there was a purely neutral criteria in terms of eligibility for the program, and it's a purely private choice, that the in- that the because this Court has emphasized that we're looking at whether the Government's being going going to be perceived by a reasonable observer as endorsing religion, if it is a purely private choice program, the teaching of this Court is, it's not unlike a Government check that goes to an indiv- a g- an individual who then spends it, all of it on...
his church.

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: purely private.
which one. And you would...

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: say that's perfectly all right.
Well, I would I would probably be making that argument in another case.

And we didn't believe I still don't believe we had occasion to do that.
happened...

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: Frankel, may I may I ask you, has the have the Ohio courts ever passed upon on on this question? I know they they they passed on the on the the single iss- single statement i- issue under the Constitution.
[Inaudible]

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: issue before the Ohio courts when they passed on the single issue m- matter?

The Ohio Supreme Court, Your Honor, in what we considered obiter, said it it found consistency with the Establishment Clause, but it had already held its statute unconstitutional on State grounds, so we never could reach that.

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: But the fact that it issued the obiter indicated that it was not concerned with the point that you're now making, and that's the highest court of the State.
I- it was not concerned with...
I didn't hear you, Your Honor.

text_blocks.text: point that you that you're now addressing to us.
No, Your Honor, it it it didn't take proper concern of everything that we thought it it sh- should have looked at.

text_blocks.text: Thank you, Mr. Frankel.
Thank you, Your Honor.

schools.
